Title: Trish Winter-Hunt on Emotional Support Geese & Content Design, On Mr. Maeda's Cozy AI Kitchen
Description:
In this Cozy episode, we welcome Chef Trish Winter-Hunt, Product Design Manager at Microsoft, to the AI Kitchen! Trish shares her creative and strategic approach to content design, AI agents, and how emotional support geese (yes, really!) can inspire better UX. From rewriting error messages to building grounded AI agents like the Penultimate Penguin, this episode is packed with insights for anyone working in product, design, or content. Trish walks us through her work on Azure AI Foundry, how she uses Copilot and ChatGPT to scale her expertise, and why grounding AI agents with the right knowledge is essential to avoid hallucinations. Whether you're a seasoned content strategist or just starting out, this episode will leave you inspired to play, explore, and design with empathy.

Chapters: 00:00 - Welcome to the Cozy AI Kitchen 00:08 - Design, content, and the role of AI 00:30 - Meet Chef Trish Winter-Hunt 01:02 - Emotional Support Goose explained 01:47 - Goose in action: aggressive encouragement 02:45 - From geese to penguins: AI agents in design 03:52 - Grounding AI with knowledge files 04:28 - Why error messages matter 05:17 - Demo: rewriting error messages with AI 06:01 - Human vs AI: who should write content? 06:53 - Advice for content creators using AI 07:28 - Closing thoughts and thank you

What You'll Learn: How emotional support metaphors can inspire UX design Why grounding AI agents is critical for reliable output How to use AI to rewrite and improve technical content The role of content in error recovery and user guidance Tips for getting started with AI in product and content design
